coredata.dc:title: Pair correlation functions for the asymmetric ion-dipole model in the mean spherical approximation
coredata.dc:creator: Golovko, M.F.
Protsykevich, I.A.
coredata.dc:description:
Abstract
General expressions for the Baxter factor correlation functions are obtained in the mean spherical approximation for a mixture of hard ions of arbitrary size and charge in a dipolar solvent. A method for the calculation of the total correlation functions for the model considered is proposed.

xocs:doc.xocs:rawtext: Volume 142, number 6 CHEMICAL PHYSICS LEiTERS 25 December 1987 PAIR CORRELATION FUNCTIONS FOR THE ASYMMETRIC ION-DIPOLE MODEL IN THE MEAN SPHERICAL APPROXIMATION M.F. GOLOYKO and l.A. PROTSYKEVICH Statistical Physics Division, Institute for Theoretical Physics of the Ukrainian SSR Academy of Sciences, 14/16 Dragomanova St., Lvov S, USSR Received 24 July 1987; in final form 8 October 1987 Oeneral expressions for the Baxter factor correlation functions are obtained in the mean spherical approximation for a mixture of hard ions of arbitrary size and charge in a dipolar solvent. A method for the calculation of the total correlation functions for the model considered is proposed. Recent progress in the theory of electrolyte solutions within the ion molecular approach provides new pos- sibilities for the description and interpretation of solvation effects [l 3]. The success of the ion molecular approach is connected first of all with the development of simple model systems consisting of charged hard spheres (ions) and hard spheres possessing dipole moments (molecules), solved by means of integral equation methods. In order to consider the structural properties of the model we use the mean spherical approximation (MSA) which implies solution of the Ornstein Zernike (OZ) integral equations h~(X1,X2)=C,7(X1,X,)+ ~ Jdl3hik(XI,X3)Ckj(X3,X2) (1) supplemented by closure for the total correlation function (TCF) h~(X1, 12) =g,7(X1, X2) 1 and the direct pair correlation functions C,J(XI, 12), r12<a,~=3(a1+a1) (2) C~(Xi,X,)= ssU,~(Xt,X2), r12>a,1 where g,).(X1, X,) are the pair distribution functions; U,J(XI, 12) are the electrostatic interaction pair potentials; ss = 1/k8 T is the Boltzmann thermal factor; p is the number density of species e (e = 1, ... n); X~ = (r1, Q1) de- notes the set of coordinates of particle 1; Q1 is the set of Euler angles necessary to define the orientation of the molecule; r~, is the interparticle distance and a, denotes the size of a particle of species j. The exact solution of the MSA for a mixture of charged, equal radius hard spheres and hard spheres with dipole moments has been derived in refs. [4,5], and the expressions for the TCF were obtained independently inrefs. [6,7]. The MSA solution for a system with arbitrary ion size and dipoles is given in ref. [8] and reconsidered in ref. [9]. The method of solution in both papers is based on the Wiener Hopf factorization technique, the ap- plication of which in the statistical theory of fluids was pioneered by Baxter [10]. In the present paper we obtain a general compact form for the Baxter factor correlation functions. A method for the calculation of the TCF of ions and dipoles of arbitrary size is presented. We consider an n-component system of hard spheres. n 1 of these possess a charge eZ, and the nth has a point dipole p~. In general the system is electroneutral: 463 Volume 142, number 6 CHEMICAL PHYSICS LETTERS 25 December 1987 ~PkZk=O. k The OZ equation for an n-component mixture can be written in a particularly simple form in terms of the k-frame expansion coefficients as [11] ~ (~l)ApkRTt(k)~7~J(k), (3) k~1 mi 0 where the linear symmetry of the dipoles has been taken into account, 1 ~ (~ ~ ~ )4EimiJdrr2Jm(kr)h~1m(r), mi n ~Tf1(k)=(_1)A n~l (m 1 mI)4~imIJdrr2j(kr)cm/mi(r) ni=Im 1~ 2 O the function J~( kr) is an mth-order spherical Bessel function; h ~ (r) and C~ n (r) are the coefficients of the invariant expansion of the pair correlation functions; the indices m, 1 and 2 in the ion dipole case equal zero or unity. The standard notation for the Wigner 3-j symbols has been applied. One can separate the equation for 1~ 1 from the set of eq. (3) which has the same form as for the pure dipole case. Thus we get the set of 2n + 3 algebraic equations (6), (7) for the 2n + 3 parameters p,, u, I , B and b, which provide a description of the thermodynamical properties of a general mixture of ions and one kind of hard dipoles. We have already shown in ref. [12] that in the limiting case p~= O the expression (li) coincides with the result obtained previously by Blum and Heye for the pure ionic case [13]. head.ce:title: Pair correlation functions for the asymmetric ion-dipole model in the mean spherical approximation

ce:affiliation.ce:textfn: Statistical Physics Division, Institute for Theoretical Physics of the Ukrainian SSR Academy of Sciences, 14/16 Dragomanova St., Lvov 5, USSR

ce:abstract-sec.ce:simple-para: General expressions for the Baxter factor correlation functions are obtained in the mean spherical approximation for a mixture of hard ions of arbitrary size and charge in a dipolar solvent. A method for the calculation of the total correlation functions for the model considered is proposed.

sb:title.sb:maintitle: The statistical theory of classical equilibrium systems
The statistical theory of mixed ion-molecular systems
The Screened Potentials of Asymmetric Ion-Dipole Systems
